alert.note: Alert for Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 11:08AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is imminent. * WHERE...The Yukon River and Delta for Emmonak and Alakanuk. * WHEN...Until 600 PM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of the river and delta and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1056 AM AKDT, An ice jam downriver from Mountain Village at Middle Mouth and South Mouth confluence is backing up water and ice past 10 Mile Island. This ice jam is forcing water and ice into the Middle Mouth where another ice jam is in place. Ice ran through South channel past Emmonak overnight but stopped early Saturday morning and the river is slowly rising. Extensive overbank flooding is occurring in lowlands from Middle-South mouth confluence to Russian Mission, including significant backwater up the Andreafsky River. When the ice jams in Middle and South channels release, expect rapid water level rises and flooding in Emmonak and Alakanuk. Residents in these communities and throughout the Yukon River Delta should be prepared for a long period of high water even after the ice jams release. - http://weather.gov/aprfc
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
